page.title: 11BEVERTON FARM
page.content: The farm has no modern services, no gas, no mains drainage, no telephone, no electricity and no mains water. He gets all his water from a spring down the bottom of the garden near to the river Tone which runs along the edge of his land. He does own a car however which he uses to go shopping in Wiveliscombe. He has no television of course but does use a small battery powered radio and borrows large print books from the library. He does his cooking on an Rayburn stove which also heats the house. He uses mainly wood on this but also a little coal. He also has a gas ring run from bottled gas for some cooking when the Rayburn is out. He lights the house with an oil lamp.
